result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Leonard R Noll in court with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #15CM191.

Defendant Leonard R Noll in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Kershek requests a jury trial on 15CM1491. Court sets for jury trial. All other cases to tag along. Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leonard R Noll in court with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests and adjournment as he was just appointed this case.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 09:30 am.
letter from State Public Defender's Office

Defendant Leonard R Noll in court.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he did see public defender and provides letter to the court.  Public defender needs additional information from Defendant.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leonard R Noll in court with Attorney John Criston Widule.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Widule states he does not represent Defendant on this case.  Court adjourns.  Defendant to see public defender.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Bail is already posted.   Defendant to have no contact with business listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Leonard R Noll in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint. Defendant allowed a non collect phone call.
Defendant appeared in person in custody. Asst. DA., Jayne Dewire appeared with Law Intern. State of File complaint by next court date. hearing set for 2/03/15 at 1:15pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
